message.content: add in my social media handles to my blog

content.thinking:
The user wants to add social media handles to their blog. I should first explore the blog structure to understand how it's set up and where social media links would best fit (likely in a footer, header, or about section).

Let me start by looking at the project structure.

content.text: I'll explore your blog structure to understand where to add social media handles.

content.thinking: Let me look at the app structure more specifically, excluding node_modules.
I can see the blog structure. There's a Footer component which is typically where social media links go. Let me read the Footer to see what's there and the layout to understand the structure.

content.text: Let me look at the Footer component - that's typically where social media handles go.

content.thinking: Now I have a good view of the Footer. I can add social media handles here. But I don't know what the user's social media handles are. I should ask them which platforms and what their handles are.

content.text: I found your Footer component. Before I add the social media links, what are your social media handles?

questions.question: Which social media platforms and handles would you like to add?

content.content: User has answered your questions: "Which social media platforms and handles would you like to add?"="Twitter/X". You can now continue with the user's answers in mind.

questions.question: Which social media platforms and handles would you like to add?

content.thinking: The user wants to add Twitter/X. I need to ask for their actual handle/username.
The user's Twitter/X handle is "evisdrenova". I'll add a Twitter/X link to the Footer component. I'll use a simple SVG icon for Twitter/X and link to their profile.

content.text: I'll add your Twitter/X link to the Footer.

content.thinking: Done! I've added the Twitter/X link with an icon to the Footer. Let me summarize what was done for the user.

content.text: Done! I added your Twitter/X handle (@evisdrenova) to the footer with an X icon. The link opens in a new tab and matches the existing styling. You can see it at `app/components/Footer.tsx:22-35`.
